column4: can anyone help me get with my wireless adaptor? ubuntu recognizes it as disabled
I am working with a laptop
then I think you want to run pcmcia to find out about your card
how do I do this? this is my first day on linux
lspcmcia returned nothing I understand: "Socket 0 Bridge: [yenta_cardbus] (bus ID: 0000:05:09.0)"
is that it?   What kind of laptop is it?
it is a HP: Compaq: Presario V2000
no it is not, but pressing the button that should light, unlight it does not show a response
well, I don't know why you are having a problem, but I think that your wifi not lighting up is the problem
how do I get it to light up under linux? it works fine when I boot into windows, it is enabled in windows, and it is enabled in my BIOS
http://www.tux.org/~peterw/v2000/    I dunno.  According to that page, it should work.  So, its a bug
is there an alternative way of enableing the wifi card? also he might have been useing a different wifi card

also my video card is nto recognized.  when I go to the hardware manager it tells me it has a driver but it is not activated, when I activate it a window pops up dowloading somthing but the bar stays at 0% then that window just closes, without an error message and the driver is still not activated.
